intro: Lantana mutabilis, commonly known as the everlasting lantana, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub that can grow up to 3 meters tall, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that change color from yellow to orange to red as they mature. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The flowers are also known for their strong fragrance, which attracts a variety of pollinators.
